hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{10}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{6}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 6](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/69de9a90aa96d74358d97a7b0e88e51cc33abc32)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{6}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{10}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60. Arrows labeled, plus 10, point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ab5d6d6599810ecefc949ac25112afaa393d4860)

$\blueD{6} \times \maroonD{10} = \underbrace{\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}}_{\blueD{6}\maroonD{\text{ tens}}}=\greenD{60}$

So $\maroonD{10}\times\blueD{6}=\greenD{60}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$10 \times 6 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
